trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy Study of CYT997 in Multiple Myeloma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Prospective, Single-arm, Two-stage, Open-label Phase II Trial of CYT997 in Relapsed and Refractory Multiple Myeloma

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - CYT997
Experimental: I - CYT997
Treatment: drugs: CYT997 Intravenous infusion (24h); 202mg/m2 on days 1 and 8 of a 21 day cycle

primaryOutcome.outcome: Overall response rate to CYT997 when used to treat patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma - The overall response rate to CYT997 when used to treat patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma once every 3 week cycle

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of cycles required to achieve maximum response

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Diagnosis of multiple myeloma per International Working Group (IWG) criteria
- Have received at least 1 but no more than 4 prior lines of therapy
- Have failed to respond to the most recently administered anti-myeloma therapy
- Have a life expectancy of at least 3 months
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status < 3
- At registration absolute neutrophil count > 1x10^9/L and platelet count > 50 x 10^9/L unsupported
- At registration bilirubin less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal and transaminases less than 2 x upper limit of normal and serum creatinine less than 0.19 mmol/L
- Written informed consent
- Must agree to adequate contraceptive measure if indicated

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a clinical research study that is designed to test the safety of CYT997 when given to patients with multiple myeloma and to test if CYT997 has any activity against that cancer.

contact.name: Andrew Spencer, Assoc Prof.
contact.address: Myeloma Research Group, The Alfred Hospital, Melbourne
